field_label: Which category describes your walking situation closest?

select_choices_or_calculations.label: Normal: I may have some mild symptoms
Mild Disability: I have some noticeable symptoms from my MS but they are minor and have only a small effect on my lifestyle.
Moderate Disability: I do not have any limitations in my walking ability. However
Gait Disability: MS does interfere with my activities
Early Cane: I use a cane or a single crutch or some other form of support (such as touching a wall or leaning on someones arm) for walking all the time or part of the time
Late Cane: To be able to walk 25 feet
Bilateral Support: To be able to walk as far as 25 feet I must have 2 canes or crutches or a walker. I may use a scooter or wheelchair for longer distances.
Wheelchair / Scooter: My main form of mobility is a wheelchair. I may be able to stand and/or take one or two steps
Bedridden: Unable to sit in a wheelchair for more than one

field_annotation:
Instructions: Please read the choices listed below and choose the one that best describes your own situation.
This scale focuses mainly on how well you walk. You might not find a description that reflects
your condition exactly, but please mark the one category that describes your situation the closest.
